TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON ( PERSON oğlu Əhmədov ) , is an NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE police officers took the applicant and his brother from the applicant ’s home to the Surakhani FAC in connection with the investigation of the murder of an acquaintance of the applicant with whom he had had a brief business relationship in GPE DATE before . After their arrival at the police station , the applicant and his brother were arrested for hooliganism and , on DATE , the ORG sentenced them to CARDINAL days’ administrative detention .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he was heavily beaten and ill - treated in police custody with the aim of extracting a confession from him . He did not however give any self - incriminating or confession statement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was heard by the investigator as a witness in connection with the murder case . He was questioned in particular about his relationship with the victim . According to the record of questioning , the applicant stated that he had fallen in the street on DATE before his arrest by the police .

CARDINAL . According to the medical record drawn up on DATE , on DATE an X - ray examination of the applicant ’s ribcage was carried out . The reason of this examination was not specified in the record . It was noted in the record that the applicant had not been examined or registered by a doctor . The medical record which is composed of CARDINAL sentences reads as follows :
“ On DATE an X - ray examination of the ribcage was carried out . He was not examined or registered by a doctor . ”
The record did not mention the results of the X - ray examination .
CARDINAL . At DATE CARDINAL days’ administrative detention the applicant ’s brother was released , but the applicant remained detained on suspicion of involvement in the murder .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned by the investigator as a suspect . It was suspected that the applicant and a friend of his ( TIME ) had contracted CARDINAL other suspects ( ORG and ORG ) to murder the victim in exchange for a certain sum of money . According to the record of the questioning of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant denied his involvement in the murder , stating that he had never ordered the murder of the victim . He also stated that there had been no conflict between him and the victim ; however A.M. had had a conflict with the victim . The applicant did not raise any complaint concerning his alleged ill - treatment by the police .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG and ORG were also questioned by the investigator . In their submissions , ORG and ORG admitted that they had murdered the victim , who was a taxi driver . On DATE of the murder , they had taken the victim ’s taxi as clients and , once outside the city , had asked the victim to stop the car and stabbed him with a knife . ORG and ORG stated that the applicant and A.M. had contracted them to kill the victim in exchange for money . TIME was questioned on DATE by the investigator and he described the applicant as the person behind the murder .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant maintained his initial position that he had never ordered the victim ’s murder . Also on DATE , ORG and ORG were again questioned by the investigator . In their submissions , they reiterated their previous statements , stating that the applicant had pointed out the victim ’s taxi to them and that the applicant and TIME were behind the murder . On DATE , A.M. again made an incriminating statement against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On the basis of the investigation the applicant was charged with having committed the offence of premeditated murder .

CARDINAL . Following his ORG arrest the applicant ’s father complained to the prosecution authorities that they had been ill - treated by the police . He claimed that his sons had been heavily beaten and ill - treated in police custody and that police officers had asked him for a bribe in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) in order to release his sons from the police station . He said that he had not had enough money to pay the sum demanded and had managed to pay MONEY . According to the applicant ’s father , the applicant ’s brother was released following the payment of the latter amount to police officers at the Surakhani FAC , but the applicant remained in detention as he could not pay the total amount of the bribe .
CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE the investigator at ORG instituted criminal proceedings under LAW ( excess of authority ) on the basis of the complaints by the applicant ’s father .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator at ORG decided to terminate the criminal proceedings under LAW . The investigator found that the applicant ’s father had failed to prove his allegations . As regards the complaint relating to the applicant ’s ill - treatment in police custody , the investigator confirmed the existence of injuries to the applicant ’s left ribcage and left ear . However , he stated that these injuries were due to a fall that the applicant had had in the street before his arrest . In this connection , the investigator noted that the applicant had stated when he was heard as a witness that he had fallen in the street . The investigator also relied on the submissions of the police officers , who denied ill - treating the applicant . The relevant part of the decision reads as follows :

“ It appears from the record drawn up on DATE by the policeman on duty PERSON at FAC No . CARDINAL of the Surakhani ORG that at his arrival at the police station PERSON stated that he had had a fall in PERSON street where he lived and had hurt his left ribcage and left ear . In this connection , a record was drawn up in the presence of LOC [ the applicant ’s brother ] and the officers at the police station and it was signed by ORG and PERSON . PERSON who was questioned as a witness during the investigation of the criminal case carried out by the Surakhani ORG stated that he had had a fall .

The head of Police Station No . CARDINAL of the Surakhani ORG PERSON stated that ... after his arrival at the police station PERSON [ the applicant ] stated that he had been injured because of a fall and he was suffering and that a record was drawn up on DATE at the police station and PERSON and PERSON signed it . Neither during their transportation to the police station , nor during their stay there , were PERSON and PERSON subjected to physical force and they did not sustain injuries ...
The deputy head of Police Station No . CARDINAL of the Surakhani ORG PERSON Alihuseyn oglu confirmed the submissions of PERSON .

The agents of Police Station No . CARDINAL of the Surakhani ORG Tagiyev Azer Abbaseli oglu , PERSON , PERSON QUANTITY and GPE PERSON submitted that they had gone on DATE at TIME to PERSON street DATE , in GPE , where ORG and PERSON resided , to invite them to come to the police station . ORG and PERSON who came to the police station at their request committed acts of hooliganism in front of the police station and this fact was documented and the relevant record on the existence of the injuries on the person of PERSON when he was taken to the police station was drawn up . They did not use physical force against anyone ...
Therefore , it was not established during the investigation that PERSON and PERSON ... had been beaten in the police station ... ”
CARDINAL . The applicant did not appeal against the above decision to terminate the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , the charges of premeditated murder against the applicant had been brought before ORG for examination . During these proceedings the applicant protested his innocence , submitting that he had been beaten by the police and that a criminal investigation against the police officers in this respect was pending before the prosecuting authorities . In the course of the trial ORG and ORG likewise stated that they had been beaten and ill - treated in police custody , maintaining that their testimony in the pre - trial investigation had been extracted by this ill - treatment . On DATE ORG ordered an examination of ORG and of ORG by a forensic expert . According to the forensic reports of DATE , there was no sign of ill - treatment on their person .

CARDINAL . On DATE , i.e. prior to the termination of the criminal investigation concerning the applicant ’s alleged ill - treatment ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , ORG found the applicant , TIME , ORG and ORG guilty of premeditated murder . The applicant was convicted under ORG CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ( complicity in premeditated murder ) and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . The relevant part of the judgment reads as follows :

“ The submissions of PERSON [ the applicant ] that TIME , ORG and ORG were partial towards him in their statements which indicate that he had ordered the murder of the victim ; that GPE and GPE killed the victim at the request of TIME because the latter had had a conflict with the victim and the submissions of TIME that ORG and GPE killed the victim at the request of PERSON [ the applicant ] in exchange for CARDINAL NORP manats and deleting a rental debt of CARDINAL NORP manats because there had been a conflict between the applicant and the victim in GPE and the victim refused his consent to the marriage between his sister and the applicant ’s brother were examined and the submissions of PERSON [ the applicant ] were not confirmed by any other evidence in the case file .

The video recordings and other documents in the case file confirm that the statements of ORG , GPE , PERSON [ the applicant ] and TIME were freely taken by the investigator in the presence of their lawyers .

The arguments put forward by PERSON and DATE in support of their defence which were completely and objectively examined in detail during the court investigation should be dismissed as they are unjustified and rebutted .

The statement and the documents written by ORG in favour of PERSON [ the applicant ] , as well as the statement given by ORG in the courtroom , have been examined in the court investigation and they could not be accepted as evidence because they had been done under pressure as ORG ’s family lived in a house belonging to PERSON [ the applicant ] . ”
The judgment was silent as to the applicant ’s alleged ill - treatment .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against ORG judgment maintaining his innocence and reiterating that he had not been involved in the murder in question .

CARDINAL . According to the record of the hearing held on DATE before ORG , ORG stated that he had not intended to kill the victim but had just wanted to frighten him . He further stated that the applicant did not know anything about the murder and that TIME was behind the murder . PERSON also retracted his previous testimony against the applicant at the hearing . In his submissions before the court , TIME denied his involvement in the murder , but admitted that he had pointed out the victim ’s taxi to ORG and ORG However , he described the applicant as the person behind the murder .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment . The relevant part of the judgment which is almost identical in its wording to the first - instance court ’s judgment reads as follows :

“ The submissions of PERSON [ the applicant ] that TIME , ORG and ORG were partial towards him in their statements which indicate that he had ordered the murder of the victim ; that GPE and GPE killed the victim at the request of TIME because the latter had had a conflict with the victim and the submissions of TIME that ORG and GPE killed the victim at the request of PERSON [ the applicant ] in exchange for CARDINAL NORP manats and deleting a rental debt of CARDINAL NORP manats because there had been a conflict between the applicant and the victim in GPE and the victim refused his consent to the marriage between his sister and the applicant ’s brother were examined and the submissions of PERSON [ the applicant ] were not confirmed by any other evidence in the case file .

The video recordings and other documents in the case file confirm that the statements of ORG , GPE , PERSON [ the applicant ] and TIME were freely taken by the investigator in the presence of their lawyers .

The arguments put forward by PERSON and DATE in support of their defence which were completely and objectively examined in detail during the court investigation should be dismissed as they are unjustified and rebutted .

The statement and the documents written by ORG in favour of PERSON [ the applicant ] , as well as the statement given by ORG in the courtroom , have been examined in the court investigation and they could not be accepted as evidence because they had been done under pressure as ORG ’s family lived in a house belonging to PERSON [ the applicant ] . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE , i.e. DATE after the proceedings concerning the alleged ill - treatment of the applicant had been terminated ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , ORG quashed ORG judgment of DATE and remitted the case for fresh examination . The relevant part of the judgment reads as follows :

“ After having heard the lawyer ’s submissions in favour of the applicant ’s cassation appeal and the applicant ’s submission in favour of his own cassation appeal and against the other co - accused , as well as the prosecutor ’s submissions against all the cassation appeals and having examined the arguments and the facts of the case , the panel of the court considers that the appeals should be partially granted , the judgment of ORG should be quashed and the case should be sent for a new appellate examination .

In accordance with LAW , the cassation court examines the cassation appeal and protest on the merits and verifies only the lawfulness of the applicability of the criminal law and provisions of this LAW on legal issues .

The panel of the court considers that although a number of violations of procedural law had been committed at the investigation stage of the proceedings , these violations had not been fully examined and duly assessed at the CARDINAL court instances .

In accordance with Article CARDINAL of LAW , information , documents and other items obtained through the use of violence , threats of violence , deceit , torture or other cruel , inhuman or degrading acts shall not be accepted as evidence in a criminal case .

It appears from the case file that PERSON sustained moderate bodily injury because of the use of physical force against him at the investigation stage , and criminal proceedings were instituted in this connection by ORG . It follows that the statements were extracted from him by force during the investigation and that , as he was not willing to give the statements the investigator wanted , he was subjected to physical force .
Moreover , the detainees ORG and ORG also stated in their cassation appeals that their testimony had been extracted from them by force at the investigation stage .

Section CARDINAL of the decision of the Plenum of ORG in ORG in ORG of DATE provides that unlawfully obtained evidence can not be used in the administration of justice and for this reason , when examining cases , the courts guided by the provisions of the criminal procedural law , as well as the explanations of LAW of the decision of the Plenum of ORG of DATE , shall not in any case use unlawfully obtained evidence .

As it transpires from the case file the detainees ORG and ORG did not confess in their statements that they had been ordered to kill the victim and only ORG stated that he had been ordered to frighten the victim for preventing him from going to GPE . Although in his statements made at the investigation stage he submitted that he had received this order from the detainees PERSON [ the applicant ] and DATE , in his statement made during the examination of the case at the first - instance court and in his appeal to the appellate court , he noted that this order had been given solely by TIME However , instead of dismissing these submissions by examining them with other evidence , both court instances refused to consider this evidence without any justification concluding that these statements had been transferred to him by the relatives of PERSON [ the applicant ] ...
Moreover the panel of the court considers that the motive for the crime was not completely and clearly established ... ”

CARDINAL . ORG re - examined the criminal case . At the hearings before ORG the applicant denied his involvement in the murder of the victim . He maintained that he had been beaten by the police and that he had never said that he had fallen in the street .

CARDINAL . NORP In the course of the proceedings before ORG , ORG and ORG stated that the murder of the victim had not been ordered by the applicant and TIME , and that their statements to that effect given during the investigation had been extracted by force . However , they also stated that the applicant and TIME had asked them to beat and frighten the victim in order to prevent him from going to GPE . GPE and GPE lastly stated that they had not intended to kill the victim and had only stabbed him in the leg , but that the victim had died as a result of the injuries to his leg . In his submission before ORG , DATE also stated that the applicant had only asked ORG and ORG to beat and frighten the victim .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a new judgment on the merits . The relevant part of the judgment reads as follows :

“ The panel of the court concludes ... that the statements of ORG and ORG given at the investigation stage , according to which PERSON [ the applicant ] and PERSON ordered them to kill the victim , were not true .

In accordance with Article CARDINAL of LAW , information , documents and other items obtained through the use of violence , threats of violence , deceit , torture or other cruel , inhuman or degrading acts shall not be accepted as evidence in a criminal case .
It appears from the case file that the detainees were subjected to violence , that they were beaten and sustained injuries , and that a criminal investigation was instituted in this connection .
For this reason , the panel of the court decides under LAW not to admit the statements given during the investigation by ORG and ORG

The panel of the court , based on the above - mentioned facts , considers that the detainees’ actions were not correctly classified by the first - instance court and that PERSON [ the applicant ] and TIME did not intend to kill the victim and they did not give such an order .
The detainees ORG and ORG also did not intend to kill the victim and did not want such a consequence . They only intended to frighten the victim . ”

ORG convicted the applicant on the basis of the testimony given before the court by the other accused and reclassified his conviction under ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ( complicity in the premeditated infliction of physical damage by a group of persons and resulting in the victim ’s death ) . The applicant was sentenced to DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant lodged a cassation appeal claiming his innocence .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment of DATE and dismissed the applicant ’s cassation appeal . It appears from ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE that the applicant complained before the cassation court about the assessment of the evidence by the lower court claiming his innocence . This part of the judgment reads as follows :

“ In the cassation appeal lodged by the advocate of the detainee PERSON [ the applicant ] it was requested that the appellate court ’s judgment of CARDINAL DATE be quashed and that the criminal proceedings be closed . The appeal was supported by the allegations that PERSON [ the applicant ] had been convicted on the basis of the incorrect statement of the other accused TIME , that the preliminary investigation in connection with this case had been biased , that PERSON [ the applicant ] involvement in the crime had not been proved in court by reliable evidence , that the court had not correctly assessed the evidence , had not taken into consideration the statement of ORG and ORG according to which PERSON had not ordered them to kill the victim , had incorrectly concluded that PERSON had participated in the crime and that the judgment of ORG was not based on reliable evidence ” .
As to the reasoning of ORG , the relevant part of the judgment reads as follows :

“ The appellate instance court examined the appeal by conducting a court investigation . It correctly determined the facts of the case , the degree of participation of the detainee PERSON [ the applicant ] in the commission of the crime and his role in this regard and correctly classified his acts by the criminal law by completely and objectively examining in detail the arguments of the appeal , by analysing and assessing , as required by the law , the collected evidence .

In order to reach this conclusion , the appellate court in its decision , in support of its finding that PERSON had committed the crime , also referred to the statements of TIME , ORG and GPE , clarified the contradictions between these statements and correctly assessed them .
Moreover , the appellate court also substantiated its findings on this case by testimonies of witnesses and other objective facts of the case . ”

“ No one shall be subjected to torture or ill - treatment . No one shall be subjected to degrading treatment or punishment . ... ”
CARDINAL . DATE the LAW provides :
“ Unlawfully obtained evidence shall not be used in the administration of justice . ”

CARDINAL . Information , documents and other items , if there is no doubt as to their accuracy , their source and the circumstances in which they were obtained , may be accepted as evidence ( Article CARDINAL ) . Article CARDINAL of the ORG provides that information , documents and other items can not be accepted as evidence in a criminal case if they were obtained in the following circumstances : if the accuracy of the evidence is or may be affected by the fact that the parties to the criminal proceedings were deprived of their rights protected by law , or those rights were restricted through a violation of their constitutional human or civil rights and liberties or of other requirements of LAW ( LAW ; through the use of violence , threats of violence , deceit , torture or other cruel , inhuman or degrading acts ( Article CARDINAL ) ; and where the rules governing investigations or other procedures have been seriously violated ( Article CARDINAL ) . Article CARDINAL of the ORG provides that information , documents and other items obtained in the circumstances described in LAW are to be regarded as invalid and may not be used to prove any circumstance with a view to determining a charge correctly .

CARDINAL . Chapter LII of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( “ the CCrP ” ) lays down the procedure by which parties to criminal proceedings could challenge actions or decisions of the prosecuting authorities before a court . Article CARDINAL provides that the victim or his counsel can challenge actions or decisions of the prosecuting authorities concerning , inter alia , refusal to institute criminal proceedings or to terminate criminal proceedings . The judge examining the lawfulness of the prosecuting authorities’ actions or decisions can quash them if he or she finds them to be unlawful ( Article CARDINAL ) . The decision of the judge on the lawfulness of the prosecuting authorities’ actions or decisions can be disputed before an appellate court in accordance with the procedure established in ORG CARDINAL of the CCrP.
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the decision of the ORG of ORG reads as follows :

“ ... Unlawfully obtained evidence can not be used in the administration of justice . For this reason , when examining cases courts ... shall not under any circumstances use unlawfully obtained evidence . The court , if it considers that evidence submitted by the prosecution or the investigating authority has been unlawfully obtained , shall give an opinion on the acts of the person having violated the law which excludes in all cases such impugned evidence from the body of evidence in the case ... ”
